words.definition: To appear is to seem.
words.example: She appeared to be sad. She was crying.

words.definition: The base of something is the bottom of it.
words.example: The base of the table has three legs.

words.definition: The brain is the organ in your head that lets you think.
words.example: You must use your brain to solve the problem.

words.definition: A career is a job you do for a large part of your life.
words.example: He was in the hospitality business for most of his career.

words.definition: A clerk is a person who works in a shop or office.
words.example: The clerk at the shop helped me find what I wanted.

words.definition: Effort is hard work.
words.example: He put a lot of effort into finishing his homework.

words.definition: To enter a place is to go into it.
words.example: Two people entered the room.

words.definition: When something is excellent, it is very good.
words.example: I got an excellent grade on my school report.

words.definition: A hero is a person who does something brave.
words.example: The man was a hero for saving the boy from the fire.

words.definition: To hurry is to do something quickly.
words.example: I must hurry or I will be late for school.

words.definition: To inform someone is to tell them about something.
words.example: I informed my teacher that I would be late.

words.definition: Later means after the present, expected, or usual time.
words.example: She said she would call me later.

words.definition: To leave is to go away from someone or something.
words.example: He left the house at nine o'clock.

words.definition: To locate something is to find it.
words.example: I could not locate my keys in the house.

words.definition: A nurse is a person who helps sick people in a hospital.
words.example: A nurse helped me get better when I was sick.

words.definition: An operation is when a doctor cuts a personâ€™s body to fix it.
words.example: The boy had an operation on his arm.

words.definition: Pain is the feeling that you have when a part of your body hurts.
words.example: His head was full of pain.

words.definition: To refuse is to say no to something.
words.example: The dog refused to play with the ball.

words.definition: Though is used to give information that is different from other information.
words.example: Though he was tired, he kept running.

words.definition: If something is various, there are many different kinds of it.
words.example: She owns various types of shoes.
